snippet: Amid worries about a threat from radicalized Europeans who fight in Syria and then return, France is arresting would-be jihadis even before they leave the country.
abstract: French authorities say they have arrested four men described as jihadi recruiters operating in the Paris region and in the south of France and one French citizen near Brussels; arrests are latest in string of cases intended to disrupt flow of French citizens to Syria; France and much of Europe have grown steadily more concerned about possibility that main terrorist threat could come from their own citizens.
lead_paragraph: Amid worries about a threat from radicalized Europeans who fight in Syria and then return, France is arresting would-be jihadis even before they leave the country.

headline.main: Fearing Converts to Terrorism, France Intercepts Citizens Bound for Syria
headline.print_headline: Fearing Converts to Terrorism, France Intercepts Citizens Bound for Syria
